description: Possible corruption of French décalcomanie (“process of transferring designs onto surfaces using decals”); sometimes erroneously claimed to derive from Yiddish.

adjectives.description: cockamamie (comparative more cockamamie, superlative most cockamamie)

examples: Synonyms: goofy, sappy, unreasonable; see also Thesaurus:foolish, Thesaurus:absurd
Do not give any more cockamamie reasons for failing to complete your assignment.

entries.meaning: (US, chiefly dated) A decal, a design that can be transferred to a surface.
examples: “If it wuz a nickel,” said one broody voice between the gratings, “I could buy fuh two cends cockamamies an’ pud em on mine hull arm. An’ den fuh t’ree cends I’ll go to duh movies.”
“Yuh c’n buy fuh t’ree cends cockamamies.” Izzy crisply revised the dream.
